com.clarionmedia.infinitum.internal.caching

Class LruCache<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clarionmedia.infinitum.internal.caching.LruCache<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Map<K,V>

    public class LruCache<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Map<K,V>

    A Map implementation that acts as a least-recently-used (LRU) cache. If the maximum cache capacity is reached, the Object that was last accessed will be evicted. This is implemented using a LinkedHashMap, such that when an Object is accessed or added, it is placed at the head of the queue. When space is needed, the Object at the end of the queue is evicted.

    By default, the cache size is measured in the number of Objects it can store; however, units can be imposed by overriding the sizeOf(Object, Object) method.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 08/08/12
    Author:
    Tyler Treat

    • Constructor Detail

      • LruCache

        public LruCache(int maxSize)
        Parameters:
        maxSize - for caches that do not override sizeOf(java.lang.Object, V), this is the maximum number of entries in the cache. For all other caches, this is the maximum sum of the sizes of the entries in this cache.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public final V get(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns the value for key if it exists in the cache or can be created by #create. If a value was returned, it is moved to the head of the queue. This returns null if a value is not cached and cannot be created.
        Specified by:
        get in interface java.util.Map<K,V>
